reviews.review_msg: Very passionate about his field, very approachable, and gives lots of feedback/answers to questions. Lots of papers but they're expected to be pretty short, concise, and to the point. Workload was reading a book (~300 pages) every other week and writing a short book review + presentation (no slides needed) on zoom. Easy grader in my opinion as well

I had joseph taylor for spring 2021 (hist 432) and i just wanna say i never worked so hard just to get a B. The entire class was graded one group papers (50%) and presentations/participation (50%). He grades pretty hard but gives lots of feedback. I didnt find him very approachable
The instructor talks and talks, but is not helpful if you have a particular question on problem. He just gives his canned answers and stories. He barely discusses readings. Very frustrating.
Prof. was biased in his marking and in his views towards students. No need to speak your mind in his class!

SFU is extremely fortunate to have landed an environmental historian of Taylor's calibre.  He is brilliant, accessible, encouraging, and entertaining.  HIST 432 is a must-take for any student even tangentially concerned with the human-nature dialectic.

Great prof great class! Probably the best (interesting) class I've taken at SFU. You must be prepared to think and participate. The topics are interesting & informative. Changes the way you see the world, very enlightening. Tough marker. Gives breaks every hour, nice for a 4 hour seminar class.

A reasonably amiable prof that attempted to make the course material engaging, yet her unrealistic emphasis with regards to originality that she demanded amongst the class was unwarranted, even for a 4th year SFU history course. Adcock's class is definitely not a GPA booster, as her marking was harsh based on her seemingly unattainable standards.

This is the second time I had Dr. Adcock as a prof. Though this was a 400 level class, I must say she had high expectations and made me work for my grade. That being said, I am so glad I took this environmental history class with her. Her passion for this subject is evident, and on top of this, she cares for her students a ton! Marking  fair!
One of the best professors I have come across, wish I had taken more courses with her during my undergrad. She gives clear expectations and helpful feedback.
